name: Vapour
description: WARNING! This game has an Age Restriction of 18. Vapour is an experimental horror game, that fuses elements of both old school and modern horror titles with the frantic game play of classic First Person Shooter titles. Blending horror, shooter, action, puzzle and platformer in a dynamic yet cohesive combination.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 64bit Processor: Dual Core 2.5 Ghz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 8600 GT (OR) ATI Radeon HD 2600 Pro (OR) equivalent DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 6 GB available space Sound Card: Yes
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 64 bit or higher (Windows 8 and 10 not fully supported yet, run in compatibility mode, emulating Windows 7) Processor: Quad Core 3.2 Ghz Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GTX 760 (OR) ATI Radeon R9 270X  (OR) equivalent DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 8 GB available space Sound Card: 100% DirectX 10 Compatible Sound Card

reviews.review_text: Played about an hour of this game. After 30 minutes of cheap jumpscares and over-the-top corny dialogue, my character became stuck on a rock and I had to reload.  Not recommended.

I really enjoyed my playthrough of Vapour, for someone who likes a challenge and loves old school games, this game is enjoyable. Most of the old school elements were there, flooding rooms, boulder runs, switch puzzles, as well as the old memory / tune puzzle (Much like Fallout 3's musical tune puzzle). The enemies are variable and quite a challenge to boot, my favorite battle was the first witch, while it might of been a glitch ,she spawned while the room was flooding forcing me to use the extra rooms to replenish my mana and health and then haveing to scamble to solve the puzzle before I drown after killing her, quite a challenge indeed. I loved the use of secret mana and health pick-ups, quite a nessecity to enable you to defeat some of those irratable wraiths. I was surprised when I reached the end of the game and could not reach the last room because some relics were off the path, a pleasant surprise to have to backtrack to find some secrets you missed. I quit this game twice, as in to the desktop and five minutes later found myself swearing and trudging through the puzzles again convinced that it was possible to beat that irratable wraith, even if he can drift through objects and screw you over almost instantly, if you have decided to replenish at the wrong time. Anyway I really liked the game and for a very small indie development team for their first game not a bad game at all, anyone who has the time, patients and persistence to finish this game will be rewarded with nestalgia of the old school games and when the gameplay made the game and not the story.Not to mention I played this game in one sitdown from 9pm - 5am, 8 hours of enjoyable and challenging fun.
Currently the game is constantly crashing my computer, didn't do it before, but now it does, what a shame :/

In short: Avoid it like the plague  The rest: Most of my playtime with this game was spent wandering around aimlessly. I jumped almost all through the level until finding what I needed to find and all sorts of items start popping up in places I'd already been.   The three enemy types encountered either were annoying, flying heads or headspiders. Or somesort of hellknight that distorted my screen when hit and as it's attack. An attack which seemed to be a one hit kill after I hit the damn thing with between six or seven lightningbolts.  Bugs are a plenty in this mess, and janking up the scenery seems to be a substitute for gameplay. Think Skyrim but without the fun of watching a horse do it. The screen was tearing all over the place even with Vsync up to max. For some reason the resoultion kept getting set down to 640x860 automatically in the ingame menu. I still have no way of knowing what resolution the game was actually running in. The launcher said one thing, ingame said another. When I set the Vsync on the graphics went from Fantastic to Beautiful, couldn't set it back.
The Ironic answer to all my prayers. Who knew it'd be behind the bloody variant of niagra falls and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥?  10/10 would swim in blood again.

Warning this game has an age restriction... I would not know as this cancer causes my entire computer to seize up whenever I launch it. I could not possibly recommend something that can do this much damage just by pushing play.
